com.philips.platform.uid.view.widget

Class IndeterminateLinearProgressBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • com.philips.platform.uid.view.widget.IndeterminateLinearProgressBar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback

    public class IndeterminateLinearProgressBar
extends android.view.View

    Provides custom implementation for indeterminate linear progress bar. It uses animator to animate drawables across different end points.

    Current Implementation: The transition drawable is 40% of total width of the progressBar. It uses two sets of moving blocks. Second blocks starts when the first starts moving out of the visible frame. As per DLS specs each block has gradient of 0-100-0, (start-center-end) color. It can be customized with custom attributes(Refer table below for details). Though GradientDrawable provides way to set it, but the visual effects are not the same.
    To achieve this effect, two drawables are next to each other and other is mirror of first one(with reverse gradient) of same size. Effectively the drawable and mirror drawable are 20% each(combined 40%) of total progressBar.

    The attributes mapping follows below table.

    ResourceID Configuration
    uidIndeterminateLinearProgressBGColor Background color for the progressBar
    uidIndeterminateLinearProgressBGAlpha Alpha to be applied on the background color
    uidIndeterminateLinearProgressStartColor Applied if the transition drawable is GradientDrawable. Sets the start color for drawable.
    uidIndeterminateLinearProgressCenterColor Applied if the transition drawable is GradientDrawable. Sets the center color for drawable.
    uidIndeterminateLinearProgressEndColor Applied if the transition drawable is GradientDrawable. Sets the end color for drawable.
    uidIndeterminateLinearProgressAnimDuration Sets the animation duration for the transition of indeterminate progressbar.
